programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Interesting docu-reality show, hosted by English actor and presenter Nigel Havers, in which a panel of dealers provide expert advice and buy off various antique and collectable items brought in by members of the public. Nigel welcomes people who have intriguing, often peculiar and extraordinary items they want to sell- anything from toys and furniture to musical instruments, and introduces them to an expert who provides them with some information about the object. Sellers then go to the ''Bidding room'' where they meet five dealers who have to bid against each other if they want to take home these incredible items.

programme.title: Coast to Coast Food Festival
programme.desc: Colin Murray, Edith Bowman and Sean Fletcher explore food festivals and markets.

programme.title: Coastal Defenders
programme.desc: Following a team of dive engineers as they keep Britain's coastlines and waterways moving.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A suivre, les dernières actualités présentées par les équipes rédactionnelles de la BBC, le très réputé radiodiffuseur du service public britannique. Créée en 1922 à Londres, la British Broadcast Corporation est connue pour être la plus ancienne société diffusant des programmes de radio ou de télévision au monde.

programme.title: Snooker : Championnat du monde

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: Join presenter Jo Coburn as she discusses the latest political news and stories in a conversational format, covering the comings-and-goings from Westminster in the BBC's daily politics programme. Featuring opinions and arguments from all the sides of the political spectrum, the show invites informed and opinionated guests to share their views on the stories of the day.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Ruby Bhogal, Ed Byrne, Ingrid Oliver and Sir Matthew Pinsent test their general knowledge.

programme.title: B&B By the Sea
programme.desc: Famous faces check into a coastline B&B.

programme.title: Jay's Yorkshire Workshop
programme.desc: Jay Blades, furniture restorer and DIY expert, celebrates the joy of making along with the pleasure of giving. He and a group of volunteers build beautiful pieces of furniture for deserving local people in Jay's Yorkshire workshop. Every episode focuses on a different person and the amazing process of preparing a great surprise.

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace visits the factory making 432 million crumpets every year. Crumpets are a British classic made from a precise combination of ingredients, using some clever chemistry to create their famous "holey" texture. Cherry Healey is learning the science of how to make the perfect batter for pancakes and visits a factory in Manchester that makes another British favourite, Eccles cakes, which are shipped all over the world. Ruth Goodman reveals the long journey of how crumpets got their rise and eventually their bubbles, and traces the history of Britain's obsession with toasting baked goods.

programme.title: Highland Cops
programme.desc: A mysterious report of a bullet through a campervan windscreen raises concerns in Glencoe.

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: The day's important national and international news stories. With Victoria Derbyshire.

programme.title: This World
programme.desc: Fifteen years ago, 23-year-old Norwegian student Martine Vik Magnussen was killed after a night out in Mayfair. Hours after her death, the only suspect in the case, Farouk Abdulhak the son of one of Yemen's richest and most powerful men, fled the UK to Yemen. Nawal Al-Maghafi seeks answers to what happened to Martine and uncovers how money, political power and Yemeni law protected Farouk, once he absconded to Yemen, which has no extradition treaty with the UK.

programme.title: Love, Faith & Me
programme.desc: Tattoo artist Alex and social worker Amy live in Sunderland and have five children under the age of five, including identical triplets. Can their Christian faith, family and community help them juggle a chaotic home-life now that they're both back to work and the toddlers are getting more and more active?

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc: Join Gordon Ramsay as he presents Future Food Stars, featuring 12 food entrepreneurs competing to win Ramsay's investment in their food business, the cash prize worth £150,000. Once in the game, the contenders will have to go through numerous demanding challenges in order to prove that they've got what it takes to meet Ramsey's high standards and ultimately the cash prize. The 12 contestants are up-and-coming food entrepreneurs with innovative ideas, but only one can be the winner.
